content.webTitle: Lampard says he'll still take penalties

fields.headline: Lampard still spot on
fields.bodyText: Germany stand well above England in the league table of penalty-taking, but Frank Lampard will not surrender that responsibility at Chelsea to Michael Ballack. Although the England midfielder handed the ball to Germany's captain to seal the 2-0 win over Werder Bremen on Tuesday, the decision was dictated by the circumstances of the game. "I did miss three days earlier [against Charlton] so I think it was the ideal moment for Michael to take one and get his first goal for Chelsea," said Lampard. "He finished it very well - it's not about who takes the penalties, it's who scores them." Lampard has missed three of his last four spot-kicks but stressed he would continue to take them. "Yes, I will take more penalties for Chelsea," he said.
